Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jypa_95IRTe2s0XlfKCxUA.text: The reason I gave this 4 stars was because I ordered takeout, this I was unable to comment on the service.   Overall, the food was incredible. Had the octopus tacos as well as the duck tacos. The octopus was definitely the star! It was so tender and flavorful. The duck was also great, but the real star was the octopus.   Will definitely visit again when I'm in Pittsburgh. Highly recommended!

_fOh0DrPWiz7QmKq1fq1bw.text: Great great food and service, nice decoration restaurant! We went there last Saturday night after a baseball game. It was pretty late and the restaurant was crowed, but surprisingly we did't wait for a long time for a table. We got shrimp ceviche for appetizer - really good, so fresh! For tacos, we go Carnitas and  Baja. Both are great! My all time favorite tacos are fish tacos, so I try fish tacos at every restaurant that offer them. The Baja-white fish here is amazing!! jalapeno lime aioli rocks! Our waiter Damian was nice, friendly, really efficient. We were happy being there and will definitely be back again.

CnEAtfnNW1kLGY525m8AVw.text: Well, they've done it again... did you think they wouldn't? They, being Richard Deshantz and Tolga Sevdik, owners of Meat and Potatoes and Butcher and the Rye. I'm not joking when I say they've got this down to a science. Cook awesome food, offer a hip environment, great cocktails and you win.  I've been there a handful of times already, always sitting at the bar. Why? Because their cocktails are killer, yes, but also because I never think to make a reservation, which you must do at least two weeks in advance (maybe even three if you want a weekend date).   It's TINY, like really tiny! half the size of Butcher and maybe offering about 20 tables. So that's why you have to wait for a table and make a reservation. But TOTALLY worth it! The taco's aren't priced too bad, in my opinion. They're hardy and you get 2 for around $10ish. My fave so far... the mushroom taco. Sounds weird, but it was so delicious. The best way to experience a mushroom in my opinion. So good... I seriously dream about this taco!   I've also had their gauc, which come in various forms that you can choose from. I went with the classic, and while it was good, it's a tiny portion for around $8. I probably scooped half the bowl on one chip, which is partly my fault!   I'm excited to finally sit at a table soon, so watch out for a full dinner recap soon!

iJ4C3JtK6UPtisP0IVn10Q.text: The newness has worn off, you can get in now. We have a great meal. Always order chips and salsa if you get the queso fundido, the tortillas are not enough! The shrimp tacos were the perfect blend of savory and sweet. The Thai coconut and the jalapeno pineapple margaritas were on point. Avoid the Mezcal mash at all cost. Oh. Em. Gee.

d3RVJgYzm5n9NzyOdHVAtQ.text: Everything was amazing! I had the shrimp tacos on the house made corn tortillas (which are phenomenal and I wish I could buy!). The drink is the blood orange margarita, also delish. The set up is great with the outside bar, you feel like you aren't in Pittsburgh and the staff was all very friendly. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

_Hf3tBTG-aL_7KuFLo8C8A.text: Let me start by saying I had to make a reservation a month in advance to get a table at a reasonable hour (read not after 9pm) on a weekday so my expectations were very high. First, the vibe is very cool and the decor is really spectacular. The service was fantastic and the drinks were excellent. I had the caparhinia and my friends got margaritas.  On to the food.. We started with the build your own guacamole, which was very good. Then we decided to share the taco board ( 6 pairs of tacos). We chose the tako, mushroom, al pastor, baja, carnita, and Korean. All of them were good. None of them were 4 or 5 star worthy. They relied way too much on creamy toppings so they all sort of tasted the same. It was disappointing. I might be back for drinks but the food is definitely not worth the long wait.

-2QEVdjZPvvFMXVpAjizug.text: This is my all time favorite forever. I'm currently living in San Diego, Taco capital of the world, and these are still my -#1. All the tacos are great, but I love the Korean. They have an intense flavor and are on the salty side which I love, but be cautious if you're not a salt person. This Baja is a close second place for me. The mango crab gauc is my favorite thing on the menu. It's so delicious and never fishy at all, but a little spicy sometimes. Also all of the margs are great and definitely worth trying! The atmosphere is unique and the decor is funky,  love it here! Get a reservation on their website, they get pretty busy!

181N18hnxXHWTKSQDqj7ZA.text: Awesome spot. The atmosphere is very unique and I love it. You feel like you are eating at a hidden secret taco speakeasy somewhere in an Asian inspired Mexican village.  The music was awesome, the homemade chandeliers made out of used bike parts were very unique, the staff was very friendly, but best of all, the food was awesome.  I had the best gauc I ever had with mangos and tons of crab meat.  My wife and I split a smoked salmon tostado which was the best smoked salmon I ever had. While this may sound crazy, we didn't get any tacos during this visit. We were stopping by after visiting a few other spots and already ate but were lucky to get a table (most of time time you need to reserve in advance) so we just had some apps. We will be back again and eat tacos for sure!

yJ7E96-X-Sv7nu397YBXjQ.text: I think the quality and the presentation of the food is amazing. My Bistec tacos was lacking flavor. I even put extra Valentina on it. I'm no chef and I am an extremely picky eater lol but I think if they cut the meat more thin it could help the shishito, salsa etc come through more. I also had the Thai Coconut Margarita and that was really tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oCbd4qOpIrQvYMjUMHTYvg.text: The food and ambiance were good but for the price it's a little much. Smoke in lawrencville has tacos twice the size for a better price! Little over hyped if you ask me!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ambiance at Tako
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carnitas tacos
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo tacos with a fried egg on top

bwPyAH4vZ07OlyJYzPStYw.text: Pollo asado and bistec had amazing flavors. You can tell they are using quality ingredients. I want to go back and try them all. The whipped cheesecake dessert was also incredible.

dSn__wI9LCrT0SWnZCuW1w.text: Awesome! The real deal! cuisine with plentiful meat dishes, dairy, and desserts

ljQpsPsjpD7dQtjHMwXvBQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Pgh. I am obsessed with the Korean taco and the guac. We always ask to be seated away from the door on our reservation, otherwise, they always try to put you next to where the hostess/host stands, so you can hear their convo the entire dinner and their light shines in your eyes, plus it's cold in the winter.

l9y4q9cior_tjTuNle1U3Q.text: The "gourmet tacos" don't come close its hype. The menu offers an array of taco selections yet you have to purchase them as pairs as oppose to mixing and matching. I ordered the Korean and Shrimp Tempura tacos. I will say there is a great amount of effort placed into the presentation but the favor is lacking!

8sqHDcFGWbggViMGjrxJhQ.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. great takos, great drinks, great atmosphere. Menu is a bit pricey for my liking, so it was certainly a treat to go there. Definitely would recommend. I got a chicken tako, chips and guacamole (best guacamole ever!), and a frozen "Baja blast" margarita. Yes!!!

xU3_duGyTH-og_kPR9lE_g.text: Truly one of the best restaurant meals I have ever had in Pittsburgh. The chorizo fundido is indulgent and delicious. We got the taco board for the 4 of us and couldn't finish it but it was amazing; steak tacos, grilled chicken breast tacos, and Tako (octopus) tacos stand out in my memory. In addition, the tuna tartare taquitos were a fantastic appetizer; and all the margaritas were excellent. Only one suggestion: bring back build your own guacamole!!!

EqmY_Sb0sOdoEZV5aaaYkg.text: This place is very hip and trendy and hard to get a table. In other words, a kind of place I would normally avoid these days as I have very little patience particularly while hungry. However, my dining companion was nice enough to make a reservation for us, and when we were feeling like two old ladies and wanted to try to show up to sit earlier than our set reservation, they were surprisingly fine with it and let us sit right away. I think what makes it hard is if you show up with no reservation and a big group, as I saw several of those lingering by the door hoping to be seated.   While entering the restaurant you can peek in the window and see the cooks making fresh tortillas and I knew it would be a good taco experience because - let's be honest - so much depends on the tortilla! We went with the mushroom and Baja tacos, which were HUGE and though they're pricey for tacos (about $12-15), the ingredients are top quality and the portions are satisfying. We also got the guac and the street corn and starters, which was maybe not the smartest thing to do as it did fill us up, but both were delish as well!   We were having a non-drinking evening so the server offered to make us virgin versions of their watermelon basil  margarita and OMG - they were so refreshing and fresh!   As for the ambiance, it's very dark and loud and trendy, as I've mentioned, so maybe not the best place if you're in the mood for a romantic date or a chill conversation. It felt very see and be seen, but again the helpful service and the high quality food helped it live up to the hype.   Huge fan, hope I can return soon!

jMdE34unOiMuJp7xPc0EVA.text: First time in Pittsburgh and first dining experience here...well done! Husband and I make food a priority when we travel so, Tako was on the list and exceeded our expectations. Tacos, ceviche, tequila cocktails...salivating this AM :)

XOt_SL4CUOuDVPs_kro1Gw.text: The takos are really, really good. Too much relish on the tempura fish was overpowering. The cocktails are well thought out and perfectly executed. But...  WHAT MANNER OF NARCOTIC IS IN THESE FUCKING CHIPS, YOU ANIMALS? I CAN'T STOP. OMG, SEND HELP. 911.  Seriously, they did the math on this maillard reaction. I'm picturing some duder in the back with a pomodoro timer and a masters in biochem. These little life ruiners are perfectly over-salted. Order a sweet and tangy cocktail and revel in first world culinary bliss.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. El fin ya está aquí.
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bistec. Almost as good as the chips.
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Airmail (cocktail special). If you like your rum a little sweet and a little tart, I recommend it.

CjzRyYtudqGuWr9TE64TRQ.text: Love this place. It us very nice in summer time. Open Kitchen  you can see what they doing fir you. I order Tako, salmon taco, and corn street. It was excellent. I will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oDtqh0uhecrtdFVfa-Y7Vg.text: Loved the food so yummy. Sat outside. Great service. Good drinks.cant wait to go back. Perfect night

XTT0mHodvOOyvF2H-8NLBQ.text: Great tacos. Great service. They were assertive to allergies and food preferences (no pork) and thought of things that I would not have asked about. For example, flour tortillas being deep fried in lard. They provided alternatives to chips without my request (because I have shellfish allergy and there could be cross contamination with deep frier. They food is worth the cost in both quantity and quality.

eblwtK2Elpmb26ZQtrNN-g.text: Went at 8 pm with a reservation, decently crowded for a Sunday. I started with a spicy passion fruit margarita which was delicious and my mom got the standard blood orange, good, but I liked the libations of the day.   We wanted to try a few things on the menu so we got two appetizers and an order of Korean tacos, which was way more than enough for two people. We got the queso which was sooooo good and unique. It came with chips (hot, salty and crispy) and a few soft tortillas. The queso itself had flavorful beef, cilantro and some peppers in it. A little goes a long with with this stuff, you wanna eat more but it's so filling!   The papas are another app we got which seemed like crispy fingerling potatoes covered in the same stuff as the queso. Maybe we could have been more diverse, but still delicious and carb filled :)  Korean tacos were really good, but didn't stand out. Too much sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So dark in there, but delicious Korean tacos, papas app and queso. If anything, get the queso!!

oj0QAl68zlvGxNkvSF6rLQ.text: I got the fish tacos and they were amazing! It's dark in there and a little hard to see, but whatever you get is delicious. It's hard to get a reservation, but it's totally worth it!

WEOaGpmVdWtjfbmBZ2OhBA.text: I came here with high expectations, I love octopus and always order Octopus whenever I see it on the menu. The octopus tacos here are $18, it's two tacos but I must say, they are generous with their portions. They give 2 big tentacle pieces per taco, and one order is enough to fill someone up. The tacos themselves however, were not good. I felt the octopus tentacle were not very fresh. The tentacles themselves tasted burnt to me, it was not cooked well. The whole taco, and what they put in it didn't match to me as well, the whole thing just tasted like a lot of burnt. I didn't like it at all. I also got the seviche, which I thought was just ok as well, the fish didn't taste very fresh to me.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tako taco, if was ok, the tentacle was burnt

Jn3_B-qUIdFlpV4v04w5Zw.text: This little taco place is wonderful. Though the tacos are a bit small, you can try a lot of varieties. Good for a late night snack.

oCZURrkbUg1XG0Pte3t_9g.text: Went to Tako for the first time yesterday and was not disappointed. Cool ambiance, great food and loved the fresh takes on margaritas. I had the shrimp tempura tacos & grapefruit margarita and savored them both down to the last bite & drop. Can't wait to go back!

uZZdC7yfpAog9kY8TlO3Wg.text: Been here on a couple of different occasions and always had a good time. The atmosphere is really great and the crowd is diverse. The margaritas are well made and there's a great selection , not just the usual suspects of "original" or "strawberry"! We started off with just chips and salsa. Maybe it's because the tortilla chips were warm, but they were probably the best I've had. For dinner, I had the veggie tacos were really good. It was nice to have veggie tacos that didn't consist of vegetables normally found in a bag in the freezer section. If there were more vegetarian options on the menu, I could give this place 5 stars.

LD0wVK8N84CARy180tqAqw.text: Holy wow. This place blew our minds (and I spent solid time in Texas). Excellent quality. Inventive flavors. And we sat at the street bar so we got to watch the chefs create all that magic.

GdWvjI3ZKSsRKEUJJGMMxw.text: Best Mexican food I have ever had!  Didn't realize you need to make reservations weeks in advance, but we found two seats at the small bar on a busy Sunday evening.  Chips and guacamole were amazing!  Great cocktails!  The tacos were expensive but delicious.  My husband got the tako taco (grilled octopus) and I got the grilled fish special taco.  I wish I had gotten the octopus!  It was amazing!    We are moving to Pittsburgh soon and will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Octopus (called the tako) taco

0KrfWWu3V0YehPDNP6L0PQ.text: Great first experience. Took my boyfriend for his birthday which Is on cinco de mayo. I knew it would be a popular day so I made reservations two months in advance. I had heard nothing but good things about this spot. Everything was tasty that we ordered. It is a small and very busy place but still worth a trip.   We got the quseo dip recommended by the waiter and other yelp reviews. I had the chicken taco and my man had the pork Taco with pineapples. We had to wait for the blood orange margarita but was very very good.  The waiters Jason and Chelsea are great might I add.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pollo Asado

FdQxhgj0BdRY_xXJzgGI5w.text: If you haven't tried tako yet, get there soon! Of all the restaurants my friends and I have been trying on our food list this is by far the favorite. The decor is very cool. I ordered the spicy passion fruit margarita which was very interesting and different. Even the presentation of their drinks is awesome.  We started the meal off with the chips and salsa. All 3 were very good and some were a little spicy but it wasn't overwhelming. But let's talk about the tacos...most unique and flavorful tacos I've had. My friend and I ordered both the Korean tacos and the pollo asado tacos to share. The chicken tacos had great flavor and the chicken was not over cooked like chicken typically is. The Korean tacos were an interesting spin on a typical Mexican taco.   Overall I give tako a 5 star and I can't wait to go back and try more tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy passion fruit margarita and pollo asado tacos
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Korean taco
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pollo Asado taco

TJXgtkq9oHpSHudT3Fn3KA.text: Was there for the first time before a show and will definitely be back soon! Everything from drinks, starters, and entrees we're awesome. Our waitress was friendly and helpful gave great recommendations. If you're thinking about trying it definitely do it!

doFF7hHpu4JsjBxH4FVYrA.text: Again these guys are killin it! Great food at great prices! When the staff is having fun the result is excellent food and a great environment!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wow

swZCECHkJ3jv_3n4u3pubg.text: I never write these, even though I use Yelp all the the to find good food.  The only reason we gave 1 star was because there's no negatives.  Looks cool and nice so we stopped for a snack, I love good tacos. Ordered the duck because I am familiar with duck tacos from someplace else down south that were amazing best taco ever. This place after 2 bites each of us both said no way!!! Got back to the hotel and almost simultaneously started throwing up.  Not good in a 1 room hotel bath room.  We did not have to much to drink. I wouldn't go back.

8fFfiMK-iprNwQRoSl2Bow.text: First time here so I made a dinner reservation. Great drink  selection (i.e. Tequila and mescal). I ordered a custom guacamole, which the server forgot about, so I'm still looking forward to trying the food sometime. Overall, this place is supposed to be trendy, but ends up attracting mostly yuppies and old people.

EX2h10xHosI7y4E9rG96sw.text: Loved this place. For our starter, we ordered the special ceviche, which was shrimp.  It was perfect.  We then had the Korean and Tako tacos.  Both were so good.  The octopus on the Tako taco was perfectly done.  The tapioca dessert was to die for.  Great drinks too.  I am from Philly, but if I ever get back to Pittsburgh, I will definitely come back!

Jce151p7EGQeKGblHWwHbg.text: With all the hype about this place, and the fact that I had to call a month in advance for a table of 4 before 10PM, I was expecting Jesus to be my waiter and serve me tacos from heaven. That didn't happen.  The place is AWESOME looking, 5 stars for decor. It was very noisy though, I couldn't even talk to the person across from me without raising my voice. The tacos were good, but nothing to write home about. 3.5 star tacos IMO. We tried 4 different kinds, the chorizo were probably the best. Maybe I would return if it was BYOT (bring your own tacos) and I'd swing by Las Palmas, first.

BiCK9LTXu--HpF-cbOSDPA.text: Best tacos I have ever had. The sensation of the taco with my mouth was out of this world.

7Hu5OXA4YbmjOFE_UbVgXQ.text: I ordered a taco at lunch walking by and was pleasantly surprised. The wait was not long and the taco was very good and fresh.

-LJ3k9555Y1a9bqMGYqZzg.text: This place is YUMMY! A friend and I made our own guacamole ( yes you pick the ingredients!), I had the fish taco and chicken taco ( we split) as well as their daily margarita special. Everything was fresh and fantastic. The atmosphere is very cool as well! It can be difficult to get a table/reservation, but it is WELL WORTH the wait! I will definitely be back.

r5DAi6UskBY82R-xXuIZBg.text: Not only is the food some of the best in the city, so is their service. Chelsea was so knowledgeable, helpful and attentive. I have food allergies and she had wonderful recommendations that modified the menu items and were actually better than I could have imagined. Tako is a must visit.

G_svKWH-5YNmAY5DR2iPaw.text: This place was packed on a Tuesday night.  Make reservations!  They had tasteful rock music on the sound system (I remember hearing Tame Impala).  My meal:  Sriracha Street Corn Steak Barbacoa Tacos Coconut Tapioca (dessert)  All of the food was tasty.  Portions were appropriate.  Seasonings were well balanced.  I would go back.

62ANAPEAagVL2XeS9BeEbw.text: We came here at 9:30 on a Saturday, and although the food was well executed the atmosphere and service made the experience an overall negative one. Almost everyone that worked there seemed exhausted and overwhelmed which is understandable given how dark, loud, and impossible to get around it was. We waited for about 15 mins to be asked about our drinks, and were able to order everything then. As I said, all of the food was very good as we had expected, but they need to make some overall adjustments to make this a pleasant dining experience.

o_IhH4H7osyEwYOMye6Hzw.text: We had the crab tacos for $20. Horrible. Fried and still has shell on underneath. Tasted like mush. Honestly the worst taco I ever had. Waste of money. Great atmosphere though.

8Op2LvYU2ed1YM0YfjrmbA.text: Great little joint!  Really good options for different styled of tacos and even some veggie options.

T95_FdSkbLoH5rZDFfkTiA.text: We had to make reservations almost a month in advance for a Friday night, however, it was well worth the wait.   For drinks, we ordered a watermelon basil margarita and a diablo. Both were fantastic, but I preferred the diablo as the watermelon was very very sweet. Then, we started with the queso, which was creamy  with a little bit of spice. My boyfriend and I both chose the pollo asado tacos for the main entree. AMAZING!   The portions were just the right size and we left feeling very satisfied. Our server was very accommodating and knowledgeable about celiac substitutions as well. The ambiance is very unique and fun. Overall we had a wonderful experience and will definitely be returning!

mi5953jOsJHGnh8Yp83hTQ.text: This is one of my top 5 favorite places in Pittsburgh.  Insanely good.  Get the mushroom.  All of the others tacos are my second favorite.  And the whipped cheesecake, oh my gosh,  a dessert this fatty shouldn't have, but it's so good it should be mandatory.

JWve-LRNqUixZx8DpGYCyw.text: I brought my friends from out of town to Tako after a bat mitzvah, thinking it would be a great atmosphere to show off Pittsburgh. This was not the experience we had. After sitting down at the bar with my friend to order a drink, I asked if there were any drink specials. My friend and I were then told to look at the menu. Which didn't answer my question. We then were told to sit at the tables. We sat at the tables, as directed by the servers, and my group was passed over several times. A server approached us. We asked for drink menus, as it was already midnight and we were done with food and wanted to continue drinking. We were never brought menus. We were not treated with fair service and after spending 20 minutes in an atmosphere that we should have walked out of, we were finally brought waters we asked for upon arriving. I understand that this may have been an isolated incident. I wanted to show my out of town friends a good time, and considering this did not happen, I don't know if I will be coming back here.

e7B5VOQmoTyp-AffXb7Eag.text: Oddly narrow layout, typical of the designer/owner whatever of these restaurants. Fantastic food, great inventive drinks. If the weather permits, definitely sit outside. Check out the sister pub next door for a crazy whiskey selection.

jsAbwQYs5pOq2N1M3YESJw.text: Awesome food and service as last time, but a big NO THANK YOU to their uncompromising policy on changing your reservation. I called the restaurant at noon today to request our party of 2 at 730 be changed to 3 and was told that would require a larger table and seating couldn't be accommodated until 11pm. No exceptions. Instead of telling our friend he couldn't come, we showed up with 3 thinking it wouldn't be a big deal, but were told at the door that we can only sit outside when another party leaves. We ended up accepting, but thank god it wasn't a humid night. We were finally seated but the reservation restrictions leave a world to be desired.... especially when you need to book at least a month in advance for a Friday night. God forbid you have a last minute change of plans. Sorry to be a bitch, because this was inconvenient. The place isn't exclusive. When you boil it down, it's just another restaurant of many downtown and you can go elsewhere. The food is excellent, but it isn't THAT amazing. Just sayin.

2VdhrJeMxKFLaPhEarUvrw.text: VERY DARK!  Could not see the menu.  Service was slow.  Food was delish.

0w5XRI4WWL1Wivgj7OCPDA.text: Margs, Guac, Tacos...all amazing! I like my Margs Clean, Guac Classic, & my tacos full of flavor! I fell in love with Tako on my second visit to Pittsburgh. I sat outside watching the skilled artisans in the kitchen make Guac & Tacos to order. My Margarita was delicious. The Guac perfection!...& the tacos...I ordered the chorizo sans egg...it sold me. I'm a fan! I went back when friends came in town & ordered the Korean awesome! Such a fun atmosphere! Can't wait to head back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wg232GvEnowOtk5aDDK44A.text: Really good hybrid of Asian Mexican. Sounds weird but it really works. Nice to sit outside on a summer evening. Staff were moderately friendly but not what I'm used to in the US, not that it really mattered.

CqA241U-gTXW2SJ99L5olQ.text: We lucked out on our trip to Tako. We called for reservations- but they were booked until 11! Luckily, their outdoor patio seating is not reserved- so we swiped a table fairly quickly.   The menu selection was decent- there were definitely some arrangements of tacos I'd never considered before. But there are also some old standbys for those less adventurous in your party.    I had the chorizo taco complete with a fried egg- delicious but very messy. I also sampled the Korean and the duck confit - each offered their own unique taste- so it was tough to pick a favorite.   The night of our visit the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra was on strike and they played a few songs outside- a great addition to our meal!   Overall I enjoyed my visit- but in the end the price felt a little too steep for two taco plates.

XtgCoCp4C8fIWcZbBbnCQA.text: The tacos in this place are really great! Love the fact they use fresh ingredients and tortillas like in a real Mexican restaurant. So far the best tacos I have had in Pittsburgh. I am Mexican and I have complained there is no good place for tacos in this city,this guys made my night!! The only reason I don't give 5 is because in their location the bathroom is only one, little for a whole restaurant and it is as dark as the restaurant. Personally I don't like black toilets in a black low illuminated space because you can't see if it clean. Also the fact that men and women use same bathroom adds smells to the small WC.

4Gdav2JpCPFP88209voy8g.text: My daughter took us out to this restaurant. We had to wait three or four weeks just to get a reservation which caught my attention and I was told this is one of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh. So I went with an open mind. We got there and my first impression was not good the place is run down, dirty, dingy and not well lit. We ended up going up stairs and it was extremely hot and also we sat on wooden tables and benches....not exactly high end.  Also it is very loud.  The atmosphere definitely does not suggest fine dining but more well used, worn out drunken New Orleans.  Then the waiter came and got us some waters which by the way were warm. We questioned this and he responded "you know it takes a while to chill water. I felt like responding "you've heard of refrigeration haven't you" but I kept an open mind.  Many in our party had Margaritas and mixed drinks which were good but the beer menu is rather flat and limited.  I ordered wings which I could not even finish as they were too sweet and sticky so much so I had to wash my hands three times in the rather unusual bathroom which I would not attribute to a higher scale restaurant.  I also had a mix of three sauces and chips which were okay but not impressive. I did try some of the tacos which were good but not worth the price...flat-out period.  Basically I can't understand what all the raving is about I would rate this place actually sort of a joke.  Food was okay but that's where it stopped everything else turn me off. I will never go back and I will continue to go to the so many better upscale places that deserve that kind of money that you pay in there. Sorry you didn't win my vote.

CYF9VR8_Vr2_en3xHTelBg.text: It's hard to find the perfect taco place in Pittsburgh, because tacos should be light and tasty...that's what you will going to find when you try Tako..you can chose one of the  deferent tacos, beef, chicken, fish ..( Korean taco the best was my favorite beside the chicken  ) octopus and more..also the place decorated in a unique way..I love the atmosphere ..sure I will try it again & again  Good luck Tako

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qoXrbDkC7qOTt3vIlOnObQ.text: Great customer service. Anne was great and our drinks were made perfectly. She offered her suggestions on tacos to try and was very personable during our time there. Both the chorizo and Pollo Asado were cooked to perfection. Would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pollo Asado
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo taco

zmUrTERY6Sp_DtNHzoB3pw.text: I've only been here once but desperately want to return! The cheese was great as an appetizer, and I feel like it's addictive! I've been craving it ever since!  The bartender was friendly and wonderful and made sure to recommend items for us to try, which we greatly appreciated.  I had a nice sweet drink, but the name escapes me. If you're a sweet drink type of girl (or man), this place is probably not for you.

O7_9F6SlKqWfufwPRMG6Tg.text: I'm a huge fan of tacos. I like to try very different ones that stray away from the traditional toppings. I must say though, the pollo tacos are my favorite. I absolutely love them. You can create your own guacamole which is really neat. This place is a bit pricey but I promise it is worth it. Also, BEST margaritas I've ever had. I'd recommend the watermelon basil (It's just garnished with a basil leaf)! If you like tacos, you must try Tako. If you're in Pittsburgh for your first time, definitely make this one of your stops!

BW_FRbKnLiYzguBoNX_BnA.text: I've had the luxury of going to Tako twice now and I can't say I've ever been disappointed with the service and the food. I had the same server twice and she was very attentive in taking our orders and was patient when we had issues with deciding what to get and made wonderful suggestions for us!  The first time I went I had the Chorizo taco and it was the most flavorful, scrumptious, piece of taco heaven I have ever had. For the second time I had the Pollo Asado. It was a nice slightly charred piece of grilled chicken packed with all of the same other ingredients the chorizo taco had (minus the fried egg).   For the dessert we had the mint chocolate ganache. WARNING: the ice cream is very minty like the leaf. It's not your standard mint chocolate ice cream kind of deal which in my opinion is awesome. When it mixes with the dark chocolate and the blackberries it creates an odd bland flavor, but once it sits in it becomes somewhat of a masterpiece of flavors.  Also if you're wondering what the little dispenser is in the bathroom. It's a condom dispenser. We asked our waitress after having a 6 person dispute on whether or not it was a condom dispenser, a sticker dispenser, or a giant hoax that kept the customers in a perpetual state of curiosity, forcing people to spend the 4 quarters to find out the mystery.   Will definitely be coming here again to try out the guacamole and more of the delicious desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo Taco

aFoLOQ9TDUqmwbZgWUKJWA.text: Absolutely delicious! If you like good food & new spins on old flavors you need to try tako. The staff was friendly and patient. We tried the guacamole & duck confit taco on behalf of a recommendation from the bartender. She said some get weird about the soft and crunchy textures but we enjoyed it. It is really dark in the bar area so maybe not 100% family friendly but the dining area looked a bit brighter.

rISPjWXKlw5bso9P7hqg7g.text: First stop when my friends and i drove into Pittsburgh. SO good. Ambience was so cool and the food was top notch. Gourmet tacos at their best! We had the classic guac and I had the pork tacos. Highly recommended! Pretty busy for a Sunday night, but it was worth the 15 minute wait.

al21S7xy6VrcErSyUxVNjQ.text: A little pricey but the smoked meats are so worth the money. The wait was not long and it's because there isn't anything else like this in Pittsburgh. I took my. Mom and Brother and they loved it as well. Shrimp tacos are the best.

Pariv3KnwiQH7Hmzo5GlOQ.text: I stopped here since I work nearby and I had heard they just started opening during lunch. The tacos are $5 each - this is pushing it for individual tacos, but it was worth the wait and it's pretty apparent that they use quality ingredients. Fusion is inherently sketchy, but these could potentially be the best sesame chicken tacos with fried rice and perfectly julienned carrots in Pittsburgh (who knows). The outdoor seating is also nice, and it's pretty easy to get take out if you're heading back to the office. Will definitely try this out again!

OjnLABCMtXkeA6UJb5Rl-Q.text: Legit. Not a traditional taco place, but everything I've had was excellent. Get the octopus, obviously.

dVLAdvrJCmrZIOU1ppgdvQ.text: A great place to go if you want a very nice meal and you want to impress your lady/man.   My only recommendation is to dress nicely, they will scour at you if you don't look businessy or at least middle class.  The tacos are absolutely amazing- but they better be for that price.   The drinks -- eh-- pricey for me but I'm still young.   I really wish they would have some events or music to bring in a younger crowd because I love tacos.

Rv8IwAOFwtAxBLdB-CGGWA.text: So I'm Here in Pittsburgh for the week and decided to come downtown for a late night snack and drink with some co workers. We were going to some bourbon bar. Next door however... I see this funky dimly lit place playing notorious BIG and outside it says TAKO. Im intrigued instantly just by the music and the word Tako.. (I love tacos. For example if I was on death row and I could have one meal, it would be tacos.) so without hesitation or any permission from my co workers I just signal the "hey we're going in here first" face. Pretty packed but we manage a seat at the bar and we are just FLOORED by their tequila selection.   So this awesome bartender, Caito, makes us all these wonderful tequila based craft cocktails that we just absolutely loved! Then we order chips with a trio of salsas and Mexican corn to start. Both amazing!  We were so impressed and I was shocked there wasn't many yelp reviews so I asked Caito how long have they been open and she replies... "Since Tuesday" holy balls they just opened and I just happened to find it randomly?! I love random amazing finds!  SO THEN THE TAKOS. We tried just a few; The carnitas, the al pastor, chorizo, and fish. Favorite was carnitas and al pastor. Amazing flavors, well marinated meat cooked to perfection, and fresh made buttery soft tortillas. Chorizo taco was good and had a fried egg which was awesome but it was just a little overwhelming and I wasn't in the mood for breakfast. Fish taco was good could use a little more flavor but I'm also not a big fish fan.   I'm from California and I'm part Mexican and these were some of the best tacos I've ever had and in Pittsburgh. WTF. They were a little expensive but still very tasty. Very good quality and very good flavor. They come in orders of two and the price ranges from about $10-$14. We're probably coming back tonight or tomorrow. I can't wait!

fx-FuVpCZcgOTLD4dY-G3w.text: Visited here expecting an incredible meal and tako certainly delivered just that!   The spicy passion fruit margarita was sweet, tangy, and spicy! Very delicious. For the meal, we had the original "tako" taco, which is an octopus taco and also the special, which was an Asian inspired pork belly taco. The octopus was so tender; you never would've known it was octopus! The fried chickpeas on it were also delicious. But I must say, the pork belly taco blew it out of the park!! It was cooked perfectly, the veggies were crisp and tangy, the kimchi was a perfect addition to the rock pork belly, and the sweet miso glaze paired well! Overall, the tacos were great.   We also had the street corn, which was rich and good for sharing! The queso fundido was also delicious, and was also topped with their homemade chorizo and peppers that were delectable! The only complaint was that there a little bit too much cilantro on the queso, but that can be easily overlooked with all the other amazing qualities of the meal. The service was awesome as well!!! Definitely will go back and would recommend to anyone looking to try unique, delicious, and interesting good in Pittsburgh.

G50ex2TbsNpTzAmdWZuMqg.text: What is there not to love about Tako?! Seriously, it's one of the most unique spots in Pittsburgh. I can appreciate the level of detail that went into this restaurant. The dimmed lights allow for an intimate dining experience! I love the seats outside that allow you to watch the chefs cook your meal and that is something I want to do in the future. The chandelier's are GORGEOUS and so are the murals on the walls.  I have been here twice and after my first time I wanted my mom to see what the hype was about. So far I have had the Korean taco, the al pastor and the pollo asada. Honestly I couldn't even tell you my favorite because they were all so delicious and unique. The different ingredients mixed together really just produced some of the best flavor. The tacos are a pretty nice size for what you pay. I am pretty picky when it comes to taco shells and these shells are just the right amount of soft. They are not dry which is a pet peeve of mine and most importantly they held all the ingredients together without breaking. My mom was pretty pleased with her visit! She ordered the Korean taco and we ordered the chips and salsa to start. I would like to try the duck confet and the chorizo taco at my next visit! I highly recommend tako if you want to be wowed by amazing tacos! Oh and make sure you make a reservation, at least a week or two in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Korean

hce_8DQfbsbPbwhWrGMfmA.text: After a failed attempt without reservations (2 hour wait?!), we got our stuff together and planned ahead.  Totally worth it!    The place is way bigger than it looks and very different from what you'd assume if you were just looking at the part you can see from the street (the open kitchen with the outdoor barstools).   Inside, it's dark and dungeon-ish, but in a very attractive way.  The octopus sconces, iron and wood decor, and Mexican candles lend the place a really fun vibe.     The food was amazing.  We ordered the queso and two special taco plates.   One of the specials was shrimp with a bunch of deliciousness including pistachios.  It was a great fresh combo and I definitely wish it was on the regular menu.  The other special was a cheesesteak taco.  This was not your average cheesesteak - tender strips of actual steak - not the processed pressed stuff you think of when you think cheesesteak.   Both specials were absolutely delicious!   Each plate came with two tacos, which was a pretty good portion for the price and quality.     The queso appetizer was really the only thing I had a comment about.   The queso itself was awesome.   The soft tortillas it was served with were awesome.  The combo, though, was a little awkward.  Do you make a very cheesy burrito?  Try and dip/scoop with the soft tortilla?  We tried it a bunch of different ways; but in the end, we kind of just wanted some chips to scoop up all that rich and creamy queso.     Service?  Also excellent.  Our server was prompt, attentive, and friendly.   As an added bonus, we asked where the restroom was on the way out.  He pointed us in the direction, but took the time to tell us that there was a big line and we'd be better to try the one in the attached Butcher and the Rye (see my review of that place for why there was no line there).     Overall, a sure winner and I'll definitely be back.

INrYWVasg2RZbqWAvu7NgQ.text: The most creative restaurant I've eaten at in years. Right in the heart of Pittsburgh and close to my office when in town. LOVE it.

D2bZbAlWJw3iB6z7yIX_vw.text: Loved the atmosphere of this restaurant, had a nice urban feel. I ordered the tuna tartare taquitos, the carnitas tacos and a cucumber marg. All were wonderful. I probably ordered too much for myself, but the portions are ideal for sharing and mixing and matching. Tuna and carnitas were both fresh and with tasty toppings. Really enjoyed this place!

mLoMUaBMCteD37ASMiW8ww.text: I was there with my girlfriend last Friday night...we ended up sitting at the bar to eat...had a non-alcoholic strawberry daiquiri to start that was really very good...then we had the tuna tacittos followed by the squid tacos and the pastor tacos...fanfreakintastic all of it...the bartender was excellent she engaged in some conversation with us and the others at a very full bar and help make it a fun dinner before the pirates game...so good we will be back tonight before Taylor Swift!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Octopus
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pastor
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wall of tequila! (I don&#39;t drink but if your into tequila you may wanna buy a stool here!)

aq_QZnYnHPnykNHO432M6w.text: It was very crowded with a line of people waiting, so I was relieved we had made pre theatre dinner reservations and were seated right away.  The waiter did an excellent job at explaining our options, one of us is vegetarian, and he also made good drink recommendations to accompany our orders.  We were hungry, and the 3 taco orders we each got were surprisingly filling.  Will definitely go back, and I would strongly recommend.

N2Vz8tYg21mAs0rVXwmWVw.text: Omg, loved it so much! We made last minute reservations and were able to snag a table for two at 9 on a Thursday. We are in town to see a baseball game and sitting next to us were two players from the Cardinals (I didn't recognize them but my husband was very excited). Anyway, we got the carnitas and pastor tacos and they were SO GOOD! I'm a big fan of carnitas but I always hesitate to order them when I'm out because a lot of places make them so oily and fatty. These were perfect- hardly any fat (just enough to be tasty) and simultaneously chewy and crispy. The street corn was the best I've ever had. I wish I was in Pittsburgh more often!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

s1L78-lnf4MaekAewcdwyA.text: Visited Pittsburgh for my birthday weekend and actually scored a reservation here on Cinco de Mayo. I was very excited to try Tako because of the great reviews on Yelp. The food was great but service could have been better so I took off one star for that.   Our server seemed so annoyed every time she had to check on us - we didn't have any complaints or extra requests, btw. Just margs, two apps, and the tako tacos. Also, I mentioned to the staff that we were celebrating my birthday (I was overly excited) and they didn't do anything. Now, I wasn't expecting any kind of Applebee's song and dance but maybe just a "happy birthday" or small piece of dessert? Nope. Kind of rained on my parade ):  The atmosphere was trendy and hip which we really enjoyed. I didn't feel that the lighting was too dark like some people have mentioned. We really liked the DJ instead of boring dinner music and it wasn't so loud that it interrupted regular dinner conversation.  Overall, great food and atmosphere but their service didn't really seem to match on the Saturday night we visited.

nRAo6a3A8dyw_dnORO6Wtw.text: Had really high expectations of this place but that was mistaken. I ordered the Korean taco and the meat was sweet and I disliked it. We ordered the crab guacamole n it was just an overpriced nonsense.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kitchen
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Korean taco

tEZoTXmDA812YKoFVbKLIg.text: A bit pricey for tacos, but they're delicious! Good vegetarian options, and they were able to make a vegan taco for my friend easily even though it wasn't on the menu as vegan.   The salsa and drinks are great, and the bartender I had both times I went there was super nice. The place can get a bit crowded in the evenings, so try to arrive early.

vOUdUjk2wI-a15znADPx4g.text: Had a great meal with friends up on the mezzanine level. We had to wait about 15 minutes from our reservation time, but not a big deal. We shared the queso to start, which came with very limited tortillas for the amount of dip. Was charged for extra when requested. The tacos were great and very rich, adventurous flavors. Atmosphere was nice. Would definitely go back.

NQYC76j_QbWjdGxEtrDpmA.text: Disclaimer: Either make a reservation weeks or months in advance, plan on waiting, or go late, late night. Luckily, we made a reservation for an early dinner - so there was no wait and no crowd.  Although service was a bit slow for so early in the evening, the food was out of this world. For an appetizer, we had street corn (grilled corn, siracha mayo, cojito cheese, scallions, lime), which was as good or better than any street corn I ever had in Arizona. For dinner, my hubby had salmon tacos (blood orange, goat cheese, pistachio vinaigrette) - and said they were the best fish tacos ever. I had pork belly tacos (cucumber, asian BBQ sauce, grilled bok choy) - and wish I could have had room to eat more! The flavors of the tacos were perfect.  The ambiance of tako is also part of the experience. The interior is impeccably designed; and, the DJ was spinning some classic '90s hip hop.   Overall, I highly recommend the food at tako!

Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. tako interior
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. tako interior

Nl0GyDrATgl4VGbhPdw8Hg.text: After months of talking about going to tako with my fiance, we finally were able to get reservations for a Friday night at 7:15. We both were so excited to finally experience all the hype surrounding tako. We arrived right on time and immediately seated at our table. I was already impressed by the vibe and decor of the restaurant. We both ordered drinks and put in our appetizer order while we tried to figure out the difficult task of which tacos to order. I ordered the Violet Pilot and she ordered the Watermelon Basil Margarita. I thoroughly enjoyed my drink. It wasn't too sweet, and I could really taste the smokiness of the mezcal at the end. (I love to try variations of drinks that have egg whites as an ingredient). She was happy with her margarita as well.  We ordered the Queso Fundido as an appetizer. It was a tough decision between that or the Papa Bravas. The Queso Fundido was a great choice and I would definitely consider ordering it again. It came with four little tortillas. It was a great combination of cheese and chorizo and all the flavors were a great start to an amazing meal.  Now onto my favorite part of the meal and what I was most anticipating: the tacos. I ordered the Chorizo and she ordered the Baja. (She tends to never to be able to finish her meal, so I was excited and looking forward to trying both kinds of tacos). These tacos were hands down the best I've ever had. The Chorizo tacos blew my mind and I enjoyed every single bite! I loved how they incorporated a fried egg on the taco; the yolk added a lot of extra flavor! As anticipated, she was full and gave me her last Baja taco. It was very flavorful! I feel that the slaw on the taco brought all the flavors together and it was a nice touch. However, the Chorizo taco was definitely my favorite so far! I can't wait to come back to try all the other varieties that they have to offer!  Our bill came out to be $60 (plus tip) for two drinks, an appetizer, and two entrees. I felt our meal was definitely worth the cost. Yes, it can get pricey quick and I see how everyone says it can be expensive.  tako is now one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh and I look forward to returning!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Violet Pilot
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queso Fundido
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo

lOoCNEZRbGEbSfCMy98C4A.text: Okay, so while the food is freaking fantastic, they need better guidance or better directions on how to get people to use the bar space which is in front of the open kitchen. There were 5 seats available and a note that said to see the host - but I couldn't for the life of me figure out where the host was located. So I finally interrupted one of the chefs and was told to go inside. once inside, host station was easy to find, and I got led outside. Then I waited, and finally interrupted the chef nearest my seat if I gave him my order. Nope, a server would come!  Admittedly when my server came, he was awesome, but its confusion and I found myself explaining the process to the new folks who joined me at the bar. I'm still giving them a 5 star tho' because the food and service were so superior, the initial confusion of how my dining experience started is a quibble.  So on to my menu selections - I got a Red Sangria ($8) which had Brandy, Orange and citrus, based on servers recommendation that it drank smoother. Gosh, this was stronger than I expected - the brandy packed a punch, but super delicious.  - For my first taco, I had to try their namesake so got octopus, harissa aioli, preserved lemons, mizuna greens and herbs plus pickled red onion. The octopus pieces were super generous ad incredibly tender. This was a delight to eat from the 1st bite to the last. Well worth the price tag!  - My next taco was the duck confit - hoisin, scallions, cucumbers, pickled peppers, mint and cilantro. One disadvantage of sitting at the bar is that your eyes feel bigger than your stomach - I saw the chef prepping the duck leg, and it looked so lovely with that dark rich red flesh, I knew I wanted to taste some. One caveat, if you are a wuss with chilies like me, get the pickled peppers on the side - those suckers were massively hot! Another winner on the menu.  - Dessert was Tres Leches to go, lovely rich peaches & creama! Fantastic heavenly smell and each bite was deliciously awesome. I'd get this again!  So, each taco comes x2, and you cant substitute/ mix or match and I ended up taking one of the duck confit tacos back to the hotel - it held up to the next day eating standard, as did the Tres Leches.  One other thing - these guys make the soft tacos in house! With the bar being in front of the open kitchen, I realized one chef's station was set up where he was breaking off pieces of dough, putting it into a taco maker machine and then cooking it! So everything was super freshly cooked and made!!  Lucky Pittsburgh, to have such a fantastic and awesome place to go eat at. Highly recommend and will absolutely return when am next back in Pittsburgh!  Note: #331 of Yelp 100 challenge for 2016

WpjOjSW7Y7ED0mFxm033DQ.text: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING! We went here prior to our Steelers game and honestly i just wanted to add a couple more days to the trip so we could visit tako again. The atmosphere, the service, and omg the food. You could tell these people really pride themselves on this place. We had a couple beers, i think one had sea salt? It went perfectly with our al pastor tacos. The tacos were big enough to share! And the mexican corn.... i could swim in it. So delicious! Incredible experience

h0aKkcn1He9nUEn2OUJtMg.text: Really enjoy this Mexican fusion location.  Been coming for a year now and am rarely disappointed.  It's small so get reservations or plan to stand near bar to get a seat.  In the summer they have 5 or so seats  to sit at . 2 tacos a board. Great to go with a few friends as you can swap tacos as they are two to an order.  Cool ambience, fast service, good cocktails, creative tacos.  My favs are the papas bravas app( never disappoints)  Korean ( a must have) , El Pastor, and the Chorizo tako are good choices .  EL Diablo cocktail is also a nice addition to your meal .  Enjoy!

BUoAcsASUVU9oMWg8LmhKA.text: When I ate the first bite of my tuna belly guacamole, my first thought was to write a yelp review. Holy guacamoley it was good. Never would you think tuna, nori and some other combo of japanese seasonings would go together with guac.  After that, we ordered one of their appetizer specials - shrimp ceviche, which was also a-mazing. In fact, because we were so enticed by our appetizers, my friend and I had even forgotten to order our entrees.   At this point, I was feeling a little full since I had some food beforehand. That spicy kimchi caramelized pork belly taco though. The moment my taste buds experienced this delectable substance (yes, substance because there must be crack in this), I knew there was no turning back. It's a shame it was only a special. Although the al pastor taco could not compare to the pork belly taco, it was still pretty good.   Drinkwise, I got Ramon's gin fizz, which is not bad for a creamer based drink (which I learned I don't seem to like) and my friend got the Hennessy Sidecar, which is a pretty solid cocktail.  This place is hands down my favorite restaurant at the moment. No pictures were taken this time (the lighting is ridiculously dark imo) but expect some when I go back to visit!

QtXMqJ07egGYsIyhQg4rQA.text: This is a very overhyped place with extremely poor service and with just a couple of vegetarian options. We went there with reservations, did not like the table given to us as it was right outside the toilets. Since this was at 10 pm there were multiple other tables empty including one outdoors but they refused to move us and actually said " this is the only  table for you" . After that with the only vegetarian taco option I requested if we could replace goat cheese with some other cheese and the server replied in a crisp manner "no". Overall very inflexible attitude of the staff. All the food that we ordered was decent but nothing great.

AuDoTPqLQ8nPHvirxGJQSw.text: It's a great restaurant to get dinner at when you're in Pittsburgh staying at the Renaissance and working at a bank downtown. The service is prompt and the tacos are filling.

v7Oc7JQgHX2T4kujLEUTXw.text: First, I would like to say that I had very high expectations for this restaurant before visiting after hearing only good things about it. Let me tell you, all of those expectations were blown away. When we first walked in, the first thing I noticed was the loud music, but the decor was spectacular! The malaria as were delicious, nut the food was really the star of our meal.  The tako tacos (octopus) were our favorite dish, followed closely by the Korean tacos and the poke (which included some of their delicious guacamole!). The server was very helpful and friendly. We were surprised by how quickly the food arrived at our table. Overall awesome meal, I will definitely be back!

idwcLW-2H06h5Z_2igR4Xg.text: First thing I ordered was the Coconut Margarita.  Could've stopped there. I thought to myself and my companion later said, "That might be the best margarita I've ever had." But since eating was the goal, ceviche, queso, octopus and veggie tacos were ordered. The queso was really good, but large and very filling and the tacos incredible. Yes, its expensive. But there are octopuses (sp?) everywhere and the bartender is rad. Definitely go to tako.

RN024tk7C5J-mfELoy1NFg.text: Finally got around to trying tako. Made a reservation for 5 PM right when they opened for dinner.   The chips and salsa were pretty good. It's nice that you get three favors if salsa for the price.   We inquired about the "Board," which includes 6 pairs of tacos for $75. The catch was you had to order 6 different types of tacos (so no option to get 2 chicken, 3 steak, and 2 fish...etc) and you couldn't order off the specials menu.   The chicken taco was delicious. The ingredients were super fresh. The steak taco was good too. Would order both again.   The service was pretty slow, but our table was up on the second floor and the place was packed. The atmosphere was great, so we really didn't mind.   Definitely a cool spot in downtown Pittsburgh, but I'd be remiss if I didn't mention Condado - right down the street, just as cool of an atmosphere, and half the price. It's a great budget-friendly substitute.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Tacos

21LVtH9l_xiP9YFv4AKgrA.text: One of my favorite taco places. We shared the acorn squash, ceviche, and tacos. The octopus taco was cooked to perfection, beef barbacoa taco was full of flavor, and the coconut margarita left you wanting to order more.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Coconut Margarita and salsa trio
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beef Barbados taco

hdwKNdRZxr3y8CZKG0hcVQ.text: Small but mighty. Offering a different sort of taco selection. We were awaiting our table at Butcher & Rye (adjacent and same owners) so we decided to grab a snack. I found the "freezer" door pretty cool to enter through. Ordered at the bar. Shrimp tempura tacos (to go) were cutely packaged and we ate outside by the tako window. Shrimp were delicious but the fillings could've had a little more seasoning or some type of dressing. We enjoyed watching the view of them make all the tacos - including their homemade tortillas/taco shells!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp tempura

8izYEFCZkkV28daTEl0JVg.text: Great tacos. Atmosphere had a good vibe. Our server was very attentive. I recommend the Tuna Poke, Carnitas and Korean barbecue tacos.

WtMMgGPCUCokV4QA2Boqdg.text: So delicious! Each order comes with 2 tacos and before I saw the size of the tacos, I thought I'd be leaving hungry still. The tacos are stuffed to the max with flavorful meat and toppings that pair perfectly. I got the Al Pastor and my husband got the Duck special and we split them. If I had to choose, the Al Pastor was my favorite. The meat was so juicy and the pineappple was perfect with it. The duck was awesome also though and had sweet potato and fennel on top. The place is so good that people chose to sit outside in the rain because it was full inside! I would most definitely stop by again!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Al Pastor on the left and Duck special on the right

g2Lrs0WUYzhe3fCna9r8eQ.text: The best taco in the state (according to Thrillist) was just minutes from my Pittsburgh hotel, so I couldn't resist stopping by.   I ordered the fish sauce wings and carnitas taco to go. (Note, they do not take orders over the phone).  The place has a cool urban vibe, dim with accent lighting in the main area in the back, and a fun open kitchen concept with bar seating right on the front pavement, reminiscent of an Asian street food stall.   The taco, while bigger than the average street taco and topped with chicharon, was overpriced and greasy with liquid. I wish they had drained some of that off first.   For $10 though, I thought the wings were pretty good. Not authentic but a good balance of salty and sweet.  In my opinion I've had much better tacos in California and Mexico, but maybe if it was less greasy I'd give it another shot.

TnyPNIxCN_Qevvs8bnzDAw.text: I really enjoyed my late dinner while visiting my boyfriend in the city. We got the chorizo queso which was okay. I'm not a huge queso fan, and they served it with soft flour tortillas which I would have preferred chips. I got the Korean tacos and my boyfriend got the carnitas. The Korean tacos were very good and different. They fried the skirt steak which is not what I was expecting, and I wasn't a huge fan of the texture. Something about the chewiness of the steak combined with fried batter did not sit well with my taste buds. But the flavors were very nice--kind of peanutty & very Asian inspired. The carnitas were amazing. I would get those if I went back. I also got a classic margarita which was very refreshing. There are a lot of comments about how expensive this place is, and I would agree that it is proxy. It is a nice casual date night spot, and they serve 2 tacos with every order. The tacos are also huge (I had to eat some of the filling before I could wrap it into an actual taco that fit into my mouth). They really load them up, so you get the bang for your buck which I appreciate at the very least.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Korean Tacos
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Korean tacos with the chorizo queso in the middle and the carnitas on the other end.

wmrL0cOJZJnjwR9c2YI0_g.text: Let's Tako bout Tako! The tacos and drinks are jam packed with delicious flavor. It seems to be difficult to grab a table here so I'd recommend a reservation! We had a reservation via the Yelp App! Our table was ready when we got there and we had a friendly server that helped us navigate the menu. I had the chicken tacos, and the order of 2 more the filled me. My husband had their signature octopus tacos and he was impressed with them! He said they weren't something he'd want regularly but very tasty. Honestly, I could eat my chicken tacos daily but that may just be that tacos are a favorite of mine!

7miGnf_7lElD8mIMpGN2PA.text: Alright, so I grew up on the border (El Paso) and I probably had a taco in my hand before I ever got a bottle. Great tacos start with the tortilla and at Tako they are divine. While not my first experience with Korean-Mexican fusion (blessed to have lived in LA during Kogi's revolucion) the food here was excellent. Would definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Heaven!
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queso and kimchee, but of course!

62H-M6sFZCT09VoFFe1MMw.text: The octopus tacos are one of the greatest things I've ever eaten. Will definitely be returning for another round!

Fwq3jbBGR_kBQDwOHbjMuw.text: The food is really good but very expensive. The serivce was slow while we were there. Didnt receive our drinks until after we got our food.

mXTSu9v15hA6SPjoTHQnCg.text: Delicious flavors that cleverly combine Mexican and Asian flavors, street food and refined dishes.  I heard so many good things about this restaurant and it really didn't disappoint! Everything from the interior decoration to the cups had personality.   I had the Korean tacos and the street corn, which were both delicious and full of flavor. I usually don't expect to be too full after 2 tacos but each one was stuffed to the brim with meat and toppings. They were VERY filling. If you go with a friend, I highly recommend getting two types of tacos and sharing!  My only complaint is that everything was quite salty. Still, the flavors were delicious and I would definitely consider returning.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Too dark to take nice photos of the food without flash but cool interior!

6r6M58QEV8tbzKBQ6ioP1Q.text: I am visiting from Chicago and sincerely believe this place is rad as hell. I entered on a whim and it has stolen the show for all of downtown. Excellent decor. Diverse drink list. Competent and friendly bartenders. I LOVE watching the chefs make the food right there at the window. I wish they had more outdoor seating but that just makes you want it more doesn't it? Man, they didn't even have the music too loud to talk. I'm in love and am determined to usher everyone who visits Pittsburgh to these doors.

98nXmd1yXT7iE8QX07td-Q.text: You have to try the tako tacos. They also have amazing drinks. Be prepared to spend some money as it is on the pricey side

fcGTiRjwZi7HCbF8v4D8SA.text: Popped in late night and we tried the korean taco's and carnitas.  They had a tequila extra anejo special which we definitely ordered multiple rounds of.  The carnitas taco was nicely done.  They cook and then grill one side so you get some crunch to it.  By the way, these things are large and you get 2 of each.  The korean taco, we had mixed emotions.  The description made it sound scrumptious, but when someone uses the korean reference, I am looking for specific things to emulate korean cooking (I am korean too).  There was a little bit of spice, but the meat just didn't have much flavor and a few bites were more like freeze dried meat.  So it was a meh.  The manager was awesome and took those off the bill and we had a nice chat.  Definitely took advantage of the tequila special and still spent $100 on the bill.  Will definitely come back and try some of the other tacos on the menu

fXG91-meknAWSX-94DDubA.text: The cocktails were amazing and the tacos were to die for. Best were the korean style.I also found the queso really really good! Definitely go here! It is an amzing place with an awesome dark underwater theme.

gVKGwbFpI8fBQLEZlZBnxg.text: Delicious food. Great experience. Service was awesome. Def will be back. Love this place and the decor is great!

IxGVFIs_fGKjYb5HYbd86w.text: My boyfriend and I made reservations a month in advance to have dinner on a Saturday night here, and it was by far one of the worst experiences either of us have had a restaurant.  Our reservations were for 6:30. We arrived and were seated right away. Got our drinks, ordered guacamole, all seemed well until about 6:55 when we finally got ahold of our waiter to put in another drink order and place our dinner order. There is where it all started going downhill - 7:20 rolls around, we haven't gotten our tacos yet, but the table next to us (who got seated after us) got their tacos. We flagged down our waiter, asked him to check on our order, he goes to the kitchen and comes back and says "there was a mix up in the kitchen, remind me of what you ordered." At this point, he probably forgot to put in our order, which is fine if he would have admitted it.   Now it's 7:30, still no sign of our tacos, our waiter comes and takes the table on the other side of us' order. A few more minutes go by, still no tacos. I asked for the check around 7:35 because we had somewhere to be after dinner and it would have been quicker to pay in advance. When it turned 7:45, we didn't have our tacos or our check, but the table next to us got their dinner, and I'm pretty sure flames starting shooting out of my head. Our waiter finally brought our check around 7:50 and I know he could tell I was furious; he asked if we wanted our tacos to go or if we still wanted to dine in, and we got them to go because we no longer wanted to sit in this restaurant. 7:55, we paid, left, and ate our tacos on the side of the road while waiting for our Uber.  Needless to say, we will not be returning to Tako. For as many great reviews that this place has, I was so disappointed at the experience we had on Saturday.

5tK28EpvnLfXkYIfE41INw.text: I mean, do you really need another review of this place? Probs not, but here you go.  If you're looking for tacos like what you'd find for $1.50 on the side of the road in Texas, this is not the spot for you. But if you're looking for gourmet tacos that's do justice to the word taco, you've found a good spot.  First, the atmosphere is great for a date, but if you want to try all the courses, it'll cost you. We spent over $100 just for two people. Granted the octopus tacos were mind-blowing even at $11 each. And I don't even like octopus. Also the tres leches is a must.   If you want a dish that won't break the bank, go for the street corn. It's gooey and delicious and pretty damn close to what I'd order every Friday night from the corn ladies standing outside Fuel City Gas Station in Dallas.

rAhX5qD1xMCZuj6bl3QbGA.text: The poke was not poke but it was interesting. I enjoyed all of the flavors and there's a great amount of Tuna in there. However, I'm not sure it all went together well.   The Korean tacos were the best though. If you go there just for those, you'll be happy! The other item I would order again is the chorizo fundido. Yum!

ygOKulN-GaxMo9fdrqZuew.text: Tako is great! Ate some pork   at the bar, drank a very nice cocktail, and chatted with the bartenders who are very friendly and funny! They were all curious about what kind of condoms were in the bathroom so we checked it out and had a good laugh over it.   I will say I'm a bit flabbergasted by the rando-decorations. There is a Catholic candle and vibe intermixed with other items. It is umm...eclectic for sure!

CVFNr6dPgusgb1GG2C1rPg.text: Reservations are highly recommended but having them adhere to the time is a gamble. Drinks are very good. Didn't care much for the TACO's; even with the fresh made tortillas.

pk3QUDnXy21nJhpdqnjuSA.text: Missing star is for the ambiance, which at 25 I'm apparently too old to find appealing. Clustered tables, music that makes it hard to hear the people you're with, and lighting that makes it heard to read the menu just isn't for me any more.  All of that notwithstanding, the food is good, particularly the shrimp, chicken, and Korean tacos.

tF8mbw6LfnzLXuGlQfhC4A.text: Another gem from the DeShantz group. The only bad things about Tako are the difficulty finding a reservation and the prices compared to other taco spots in the area. Drinks are great and tacos are anything but ordinary. We had sangria, house guacamole, fish and chicken tacos. The big board (6 pairs of tacos) is on tap for the next visit. This place is great for date night, pre-show dinner, or friends night out.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oR0IgO3jLgzcizib93ofAA.text: So good! Best tacos I've ever had! Really! The quality and freshness was so good! You get two tacos and they are really big. Couldn't finish the second. We also got guac and chips, which did not disappoint. I definitely want to go back again. I just couldn't believe how good the tacos are. Even for dinner, they're reasonably priced. The ambiance was really nice, however it is a bit tight seating wise. The waiters were all very nice. I will go back to Pitt just for this place!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken tacos!

7R2x1KOqgDzVhyQd62b3iQ.text: This review is long overdue; but there's not much to say that hasn't already been said. Tako is phenomenal, and I'm already planning my next visit!   My whole table ordered different drinks, but the winner was the grapefruit and sage margarita (my pick, naturally). This margarita is not to be missed - refreshing and just bitter enough.   The only downside, in my opinion, was the service. We had a larger group, which isn't optimal for tako's space. Our waiter seemed a bit annoyed by that. He was constantly coming to our tables and nearly pushed us out of the restaurant. But the food made up for it, so we were not to hung up on the less-than-desirable service.   A tip: be sure to make a reservation, since the space is quite small.   Looking forward to my next time at tako!

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. All the tacos
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab guacamole
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grapefruit sage margarita

Sa6ffBQpSsuK5ziPpRP7lA.text: I was very disappointed in my meal here. A friend and I went, knowing it would be expensive but hoping great flavor would make up for it. We got two different kinds of taco (so 4 tacos total). We got the octopus taco and pastor taco.   The Octopus taco is what they're known for, so I was excited to try it. I ended up not being able to finish it because I couldn't get past the texture of the octopus, and I didn't feel like it had a ton of flavor. I really enjoyed the pastor taco, it had good flavor and I really enjoyed the citrus/pineapple flavor. We got the tacos on corn tortillas instead of the classic flour, and I enjoyed those as well. I thought the flavor complemented the flavor of the pastor taco well.  I am glad I came here and got to experience it, but over all I would say the food is not worth the money. Bakersfield was pretty close to just as good but at a way cheaper price. We spent $44 on 4 tacos when you add tip and tax, and I was so hungry after that I had to buy a whole other dinner somewhere else. I did only eat about 1 and 1/3 of a taco, but I don't think eating the whole second taco would have made me any less hungry.

E3i4MT4wt_RBdhkid-HHWg.text: Korean tacos. Drop the mic.  Game over.  This is my favorite taco place in the city (among several good options).  I don't think you can go wrong with any taco. The fish taco was excellent.  The fish was crispy and not greasy at all.  The street corn is very good; guacamole and margaritas delicious.  Reservation recommended.

cPIFilDdkz6TNGZe28py4g.text: If you are looking for some more authentic tacos than this may not be the place. Despite that the quality is great. Highly recommend the carnitas for the more authentic mexican vibe. Its comparable to many of my fave spots growing up in LA ( except just not served from a shopping cart or out of a food truck that hasnt been driven in a decade)

jGXsf0rYkEzeMFy7JoDmaQ.text: This place has some STACKED tacos. At first glance, the price per taco may seem pretty steep (two tacos per order), but by the amount of food you get per taco, you will definitely be filled up by two tacos! The chicken nachos are delish, and their poke is top notch as well. I would recommend getting their baja fish tacos. The batter is light and the fish is fried and flaky to perfection! Definitely a great place to go with friends, family, or even by yourself if it's just that type of night.

PKdNsjxe_1QagJ43DMGjrw.text: Pastor tacos were above average? The flavor was there, and the taco shells were good but the meat was dry and overall underwhelming.   Chorizo Fundido was also pretty good. Tons of flavor and the soft shell tacos were a nice touch opposed to fried tortilla chips. $12 was excessive.  The real standout was the street corn. This stuff was excellent!   I also got the Evil Genius cocktail and it was fantastic.  The tacos didn't deter me from maybe trying other ones in the future, but they are barely worth the price. It'd have to be some occasion to return. The ambiance is nice and all but there are much better, more affordable options in the Pittsburgh area. $8-$10 a taco is pretty steep.

koDPsxB_rkSW8haHH29o-A.text: "Good not great" would be how I describe tako. I had been wanting to come here for awhile. The tacos were good but not the best I've eaten.  The tacos were not traditional tacos. I would describe them as "trendy".  Trendy versus traditional is fine, and usually something I'm into it, but these tacos didn't hit the spot like I'd hoped for.   The restaurant is in a tight space. There are fun, interesting paintings on the wall.   I would not suggest this place on my own as a restaurant to return to, but if others wanted to go I'd go back.

lybcd3FS7C6d3THGoyi_4g.text: This is probably my third favorite taco IN THE COUNTRY!   The lamb tacos were to die for. Lets start with the meat - succulent, tasty, and juicy as hell. The real kicker is the other ingredients. Perfect in variety, portion, and layering. The crispies inside the taco were DIVINE. Let's finish with the tortilla. So nice, unique, and tasty!  The choco taco was delicious as well. A very 'chef'y dessert with dark cherries on bottom. The ceviche was good not great. I'll have to try the guac and more tacos next time.  It's very dark and vibey in here. Hipster fancy ta  Definitely come here when in Pittsburgh. I do wish when I got bar seating and there was a seat outside, they had seated more there instead of inside though. Poor hostess move. The awesome bartender makes up for it.

photos.caption: Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Choco taco
Photo of täkō - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb tacos mmm

rYwUUd0lRuz43EB5KDru3A.text: Great delicious food! Octopus taco is definitely the best!!  - unfortunately the place is very small so waiting in line long time will happens if you are thinking to eat in a table. You can always reserve... The bar is also an option but you have to arrive either at 4:30 or 9:30... otherwise you will have to almos fight for a drink!! However the drinks are so well prepared that if you are in the mood of waiting or stumble upon other people then that's your place!!

cUmXMBKkEKbeik6gUOkX4w.text: I love this place! The only complaint I have is it is pretty quiet in the early evening, which is not a bad thing! However when we were trying to ask the bartender other restaurant to visit while in the city he seemed to busy talking to his co-workers than to help us. Other than that we had salsa a fabulous drink! Great time overall!

uVX31Em9jYQif-G2K5toSw.text: The absolute BEST tacos in Pittsburgh. These are high class tacos like no other. My mom has bought me a gift card to here for my birthday because it is a little pricey - but for good reason.
